alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:06AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Baldwin, west central Santa Rosa and central Escambia Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 606 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Point Clear to Lillian. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daphne, Fairhope, Gonzalez, Spanish Fort, Robertsdale, Loxley, Stapleton, Molino, Summerdale and Silverhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
